publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1651 Rosie Kane: Segregation in the New Parliament—That the Parliament agrees to strive to ensure that it is an inclusive modern democracy; condemns, therefore, the decision to create separate entrances and eating areas in the new building which segregate MSPs from workers; furthermore believes that this is a backward step given that, in the previous parliament building, all workers, including MSPs, entered and dined together, and is concerned that this will serve to create an unhealthy "them and us" division. Supported by: Campbell Martin*
S2M-1651 Segregation in the New Parliament (lodged on 7 September 2004) Tommy Sheridan*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Frances Curran*
S2M-1651 Segregation in the New Parliament (lodged on 7 September 2004) Chris Ballance*, Eleanor Scott*, Shiona Baird*

S2M-1651 Rosie Kane: Segregation in the New Parliament—That the Parliament agrees to strive to ensure that it is an inclusive modern democracy; condemns, therefore, the decision to create separate entrances and eating areas in the new building which segregate MSPs from workers; furthermore believes that this is a backward step given that, in the previous parliament building, all workers, including MSPs, entered and dined together, and is concerned that this will serve to create an unhealthy "them and us" division. Supported by: Campbell Martin, Tommy Sheridan, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Frances Curran, Chris Ballance, Eleanor Scott, Shiona Baird
S2M-1651 Segregation in the New Parliament (lodged on 7 September 2004) Carolyn Leckie*
